ygData.subject: Re: Trades & Experience
ygData.msgSnippet: thanks renaldo - i have never had the pleasure of actually owning or doing the traveler s bp quest, so i was only going on what i was told :) ... From:
ygData.messageBody:
thanks renaldo - i have never had the pleasure of actually owning or doing
the traveler's bp quest, so i was only going on what i was told :)
----- Original Message -----
From: <Valharick@...>
To: <EQCheats@onelist.com>
Sent: Tuesday, July 27, 1999 5:38 AM
Subject: Re: [EQCheats] Trades & Experience


> From: Valharick@...
>
> In a message dated 7/27/99 2:21:59 AM Pacific Daylight Time,
> indrika@... writes:
>
> << I didn't say it would be easy, you do have to work to get what you want
if
> you really want to do it, it's part of the game, and you either accept it
or
> don't, choice is yours, Yes, the ores are heavey, 15weight is a lot to
carry
> around when you're not a typical ogre/troll/barbarian. But , with a
little
> ingenuity, one could think up possibly buying a few summoned bags off of
a
> shaman or doing the traveler's backback quest - both items which make
> anything in them weightless. I have done the majority of all my
> blacksmithing and pottery by fetching the materials from the mudites, and
it
> has been long tedious and at times down right irritating, but i've worked
> hard for what i've made :) >>
>
> Actually the travellers pack only reduces wqeight by 20%. Same with
pierce's
> pack or storing. The summoned bags you are correct on however.
>
> Renaldo Singer of the 18th song
